intro: Russelia paniculata, commonly known as the coral vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its cascading clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has heart-shaped, dark green leaves that are opposite on the stems. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Russelia paniculata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and ability to climb or trail.
